positive.review: There was no reason to remove color from the cover arts, aszholes.

This has remained one of my favorite games since childhood. It's easy to learn, has great campaigns, and you can make it as easy or as difficult as you want. I love that the random maps allow you to choose the strategy style of yourself and enemies, choose gods, land, etc. I also love the mythological creatures, different mythological lore, and characters included in the various campaigns. 

On another note, I was so excited for the remastered version of this game. I thought it's long been overdue, but the slight changes to it were worse in my opinion. The voice acting was terrible, I didn't find the monsters to be much of an upgrade, and I found the additional things on screen were more nuisance than helpful...without even containing any additional mechanics. It was just terrible. While I would still love a remaster version of this game, this edition is still far better than the current remastered version on Steam. Highly recommend this version of the game!!
This game is my childhood and i keep coming back to it when life gets hard , it really feels like home . Soon ima buy the retold version , i hope it worth the money and the time.
An oldie but a goodie. I definitely recommend this game for anyone who loves old Mythology. The story is quite fun and it's quite and expansive game. Great if you're old or young.
I really enjoy the different options that allows you to create many different playing scenarios.

Really fun and definitely worth getting

Cons:

I give it 8.9/10
This game brings great nostalgia for me as I played it quite a lot as a kid. Highly recommend for anyone who enjoys mythology and RTS games.
The original game is a great strategy game, and this is a fun way to replay it. Probably worth picking up the newest edition instead of this, but this isnt a bad way to re-experience this gem.
The only reason I bought this game is because I love mythology and AoE series. Nice graphs, funny compains but not atractive or strategical as before..More like having funn with myth Heroes...
A true classic. It gave me hundreds of hours of fun when I was a kid, and once I found it here I just couldn’t resist. Pure nostalgia.
As one of my first game ever played back in 2003-04  , i still enjoy the awesome in-game music and Campaign.
One of the best games I used to play when I was a kid — it’s so beautiful. Ahh, the memories!
Good old Good old and still works well today!
Its always been ne of my favorites in the Age of series.

There was no reason to remove color from the cover arts, aszholes.

This is a great game. For some reason the game developers and steam just don't want to put it at the price it should be. They'd probably increase their sales by 10-20%. My opinion it should be around $10-15 at most. Retold would be a better option. But not everyone has a dedicated graphics card, or decent internet connection
I love this game. I played the original back in like 2005 and it's fun to be able to play it again.

I'm going to go ahead and review this game even though it's now outdated vis a vis extended Retold.

AoM Extended Edition delivers a mostly true to classic experience with functional multiplayer, even if a bit less these days. The graphics are barely upgraded from the original but you can effortlessly play in full hd. The chinese campaign is, questionable at best but it's something.

For the people who can't run Retold and neither the original, extended edition is a great solution to relive those childhood/youthful memories of Age of Mythology with friends or your kids. Overall I'd have recommended this even before Retold was launched because of workshop support.

This has remained one of my favorite games since childhood. It's easy to learn, has great campaigns, and you can make it as easy or as difficult as you want. I love that the random maps allow you to choose the strategy style of yourself and enemies, choose gods, land, etc. I also love the mythological creatures, different mythological lore, and characters included in the various campaigns. 

On another note, I was so excited for the remastered version of this game. I thought it's long been overdue, but the slight changes to it were worse in my opinion. The voice acting was terrible, I didn't find the monsters to be much of an upgrade, and I found the additional things on screen were more nuisance than helpful...without even containing any additional mechanics. It was just terrible. While I would still love a remaster version of this game, this edition is still far better than the current remastered version on Steam. Highly recommend this version of the game!!

Prostagma? Etimos! 
This game's old but shiny gold! I haven't tried the remake but honestly AoM: Extended Edition has aged perfectly fine. It's more than simple nostalgia, it's genuinely still fun and worth playing. 
Gameplay, Story, Soundtrack all are EPIC. Don't let it's age stop you from experiencing this gem of a game!

The bad: 
It's expensive given it's age & occasionally AI can be buggy but this has never ruined my experience. 
The online is hit and miss too. (Lastly, I hate how they desaturated the artwork to manipulate people into buying the remake but this doesn't affect gameplay.)

Had fun with the game in LAN. Played against my step son, he wanted to build titans and a big army. Later we battle in the middle of the map.

Recommend playing casual.

7/10

Pros:
-Legendary, cassic RTS, one of the best game of the genre, probably on the level of Starcraft
-Good PvE solo campaign you can enjoy even now
-Tons of great things in steam workshop
Cons:
1. The game price is absolutely unfair to this days
1.1 And it will NEVER got a discounts anymore;
2. No reason to buy for PvP/Multiplayer: Microsoft buried this game alive when released Retold. Very low online, sh1t ping and FPS! (somehow, while multiplayer), some of forgotten spanish players that don't speak english will be your only enemies and ofc we'll never receive an any updates/balance patches anymore (the last one dated of 2019).

Devs will close game servers for multiplayer soon, it's just a matter of time, like it was with classic AoE 3 (one year ago).
Fantastic Game, No complaints, it relax's me and keeps me calm and i am looking forward to the squeal.
An oldie but a goodie. I definitely recommend this game for anyone who loves old Mythology. The story is quite fun and it's quite and expansive game. Great if you're old or young.
I really enjoy the different options that allows you to create many different playing scenarios.

Really fun and definitely worth getting

if you want an amazing campaign play this game, 20 years later it still holds up as one of the best games ive ever played if you want online pvp play aoe2
One of the best strategy games I've played, with a very captivating storyline.
Great strategic game. Love the civilations and the pros and cons of each. Highly recommend this game.
Played this a lot back in the day, and still would recommend, it's like Age of Empires II, just with God powers.
Such a fun build & strategy game! Love the inventive story lines.

Overall a wonderful RTS game among all the RTS games I have played over the years. It's a must-play for those who are into a good combination of ancient human army and mythological units! I hope the game can keep updating and expanding to have more civilizations.
A true classic. It gave me hundreds of hours of fun when I was a kid, and once I found it here I just couldn’t resist. Pure nostalgia.
As one of my first game ever played back in 2003-04  , i still enjoy the awesome in-game music and Campaign.
Just a great old classic. Easy to play. Enjoyable.
One of the best games I used to play when I was a kid — it’s so beautiful. Ahh, the memories!
This is my all time favourite game. Nostalgia man I’m gonna but AoM Retold soon as well!!
Really awesome game. Not perfect, but legendary still.
This game is my childhood and i keep coming back to it when life gets hard , it really feels like home . Soon ima buy the retold version , i hope it worth the money and the time.
classic pc game gotta Love it. Id also check out Hero's of Might and magic. its another childhood memory for me.

A true classic. Much more simplistic than Age of Empires, but no less addictive. And it's hilarious to see units get punted across the screen by tougher units. Really could've done with more civilizations, though.
it is very fun and kind of like a fun way to do history... but thats not what its about
Good old Good old and still works well today!
Its always been ne of my favorites in the Age of series.
Holds up well compared to other RTS games that followed.

negative.review: Okay, I re-installed the game and then left a review while it installed and I was basically praising it. Not anymore. It installed and now it won't open at all. Black screen then crash to desktop. Turns out everyone else seems to be having this issue. I bought this like a year or two to re-live my childhood nostalgia, had to uninstall it for a bit, and now it is ruined. Screw you, devs. Stealing my god damn money and then corrupting the game to be unplayable. Gaming has been ruined these days by people like you, and also not being able to just pop a disc into the drive and play a game.

Okay, I re-installed the game and then left a review while it installed and I was basically praising it. Not anymore. It installed and now it won't open at all. Black screen then crash to desktop. Turns out everyone else seems to be having this issue. I bought this like a year or two to re-live my childhood nostalgia, had to uninstall it for a bit, and now it is ruined. Screw you, devs. Stealing my god damn money and then corrupting the game to be unplayable. Gaming has been ruined these days by people like you, and also not being able to just pop a disc into the drive and play a game.
Not a bad game, but get AoM: Retold on sale instead. Retold is just allot better and looks and plays better as well.
INITIALIZATION FAILED. GAME DEPENDENT INIT FAILED. This has been working for years then you pulled this shit. TRASH.
they mad it look ugly in libbray onporposes...   :(
I found myself playing alone, the other team don't even move
Why is the game still available for purchase?
